title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate in Pakistan 2024
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2014.
Likewise, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2023 to 2020.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2020 to 2018.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2024 to 2023.
gold: Pakistan 's gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth was 5.53 percent in 2018 after adjusting for inflation . However , projections for the coming years predict that GDP will grow at a rate around 5 percent in the coming years . GDP in developing nations Gross domestic product measures value of all final goods and services produced within a country 's borders during a certain period of time .
